faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: During the course the students get an overview on the etiology and mechanisms of development of basic syndromes and diseases at the level of organism, tissue, cell, and molecules as well as on the effects of pathogenic changes on the functions of organism.
description.et: Kursuses käsitletakse põhiliste sündroomide ja haiguste etioloogiat ja arengumehhanisme organismi, koe, raku ja molekulide tasandil ning haiguslike muutuste toimet organismi funktsioonidele.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to provide the students with the basic knowledge on pathophysiology, useful to understand the etiology and pathogenesis of diseases and to use this knowledge for diagnosis and treatment of diseases.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärgiks on anda üliõpilastele patoloogilise füsioloogia alaseid algteadmisi, mis aitaksid mõista haiguste etioloogiat ja patogeneesi mehhanisme nüüdisaegsel tasemel ja osata kasutada neid teadmisi haiguste diagnoosimisel ja ravis.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who graduated the course:
- knows pathologic processes and mechanisms of development;
learning_outcomes.et: - teab patoloogilisi protsesse ja nende arengumehhanisme;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows ethiology of the disorders of water and salt balance, acid-base balance, carbohydratis  and lipoprotein metabolism with main compensatory mechanisms in this case;
learning_outcomes.et: - teab vee- ja elektrolüütide ainevahetuse, happe-leelise tasakaalu häirete, süsivesiku ja lipoproteiidide ainevahetuse häirete etioloogilisi faktoreid ja oskab analüüsida organismi elutegevuse muutusi aga ka põhilisi kompensatsiooni mehhanisme nende puhul;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows alterations in function and regulation of organs and systems during pathologic processes and diseases and can also analyse the mechanisms of pathogenesis.
learning_outcomes.et: - teab elundsüsteemide talitluse ja regulatsiooni muutusi patoloogiliste protsesside ning enamlevinud haiguste puhul ja oskab analüüsida patogeneesi mehhanisme.

independent_work.et: Grading the presentation of essays we will consider the content of presentation, watchfulness, presentation materials and skills and ability of a student to answer to questions of other students and tutor. The 5-10 pp written essay is also the object of grading.

description.et:
During large written test there are 3 questions were we expect assay type answers. Questions are evaluated separately and then summarized. 
According to the total points the student gets result from A to F:
A 93-100%
B 85-92% 
C 77-84% 
D 69-76%
E 60-68%
F 0-59.4%

grade_preconditions.et:
1) At least 90% of practical works and seminars have to be done to be allowed to take the final exam. All two large written tests have been done at least on the level of E. The short tests and pretests are done. 
2) If the quantity of missed seminar and practical works are in the region of 75-90% the student has an opportunity to liquidate lacking seminar work theme by presentation of essay to supervisor of the seminar; or to remake practical works an opportunity will be in the end of semester (15-16th week) according schedule proposed by department. 
3) If the student has not mark on essay then there is an additional question at exam.

grade_evaluation.et:
The students have an opportunity to get an examination mark without writing the final examination if they fulfill the following conditions:
- The student passes all of the two big tests on time (with a result of at least 60%)
- The student passes all of the small tests and the essay presentation with a positive grade (at least 60%).
- The student has participated in the practical and seminar works in conditions as described above.

If the above conditions are met, the final grade consists of the following:
60% - the results of the big tests
20% - the result of short tests
20% - the result of the essay/ presentation

If you have to write the final exam, the final grade consists of the following:
60% - the result of the written exam
20% - the result of the big tests
10% - the result of short tests
10% - the result of the essay/presentation

The minimal eligible level of knowledge is 60%.

Grading system:
60% - 68% - E
69% - 76% - D
77% - 84% - C
85% - 92% - B
93% - 100% - A

debt_elimination.et:
1) The options to remake big tests and short tests are in 2 weeks after the proper time according to the schedule proposed by the department.
2) Backlogs in seminar work may be liquidated by presentation of an essay to the supervisor of the seminar (agree upon the topic with the supervisor)
3) All backlogs have to be done to before the final exam.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
1. K.L. McCance, S.E. Huether  Pathophysiology: The biologic basis for disease in adults and children. Elsevier, 2014.
2.  Silbernagl, F. Lang Color Atlas of Pathophysiology. Thieme, Berlin, 2000, 2010.
3. G. D. Hammer; SJ. McPhee Pathophysiology of Disease: An Introduction to Clinical Medicine, 8e 2019 McGraw-Hill Education  Available online at utlib.ee (Access Medicine)
resources.recommended_materials:
3. S V. Kumar A.K. Abbas, N. Fausto   Robbins and Cotran Pathologic Basis of Disease W.B. Saunders Co, Philadelphia, 2005, 2009.
4. L. S. Lilly Pathophysiology of Heart Disease. A Collaborative project of medical students and faculty. Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, 2006. 
5. L. H. Opie Heart Physiology: From Cell to Circulation. Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, 2003. 
6. V. Hoffbrand, J. Pettit, P. Moss Essential Haematology. Blackwell Publishing Ltd, 2006. 
7. J.B. West Pulmonary Pathophysiology: The Essentials. Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, 2007.
8. R. Chew et al Gastrointestinal System Crash Course - UK, Mosby, 2008.
E. Seppet Sissejuhatus patofüsioloogiasse ja rakukahjustuse mehhanismid. Medicina, 2001.
9. Enn Seppet, Elviira Seppet Neeru patofüsioloogia. Medicina, 2001.
10. H.G.Rannke, B.D. Rose, B.M. Denker Renal Pathophysiology. The Essentials. Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, 2006.
11. C. B Niewoenher Endocrine Pathophysiology. Hayens Barton Press, 2004.
